Floral basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Floral basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestinian President 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Palestinian President Yasser Arafat to mark his birthday.
 The floral basket was conveyed to Jong Ha Chol, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK, on Monday.

Iranian Ambassador hosts reception
articles.content:
Iranian Ambassador hosts reception 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Jalaleddin Namini Mianji, Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy on Monday evening on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution in Iran.
 Present on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, Vice-President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Won Il, Minister of Labor who is chairman of the Korea-Iran Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.    
 Apeeches were made there.

North side's delegation leaves
articles.content:
North side's delegation leaves
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation of the North-South Committee for Promotion of Economic Cooperation led by Pak Chang Ryon, north side's chairman of the committee who is first-vice chairman of the DPRK State Planning Commission, left here today to participate in the fourth meeting of the committee to be held in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Ro Tu Chol, vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission, Jong Un Op, chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Federation, and officials concerned.

DPRK Ambassador to Libya appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Libya appointed
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Ri Pyong Ho was appointed as DPRK Ambassador to Libya under a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: S. Korean visiting group leaves
articles.content:
S. Korean visiting group leaves
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A visiting group of the "Movement of Koreans for Helping Each Other," a non-governmental organization of South Korea, co-led by permanent representative of the movement Song Hyon Sop, chairman of the central council of the New Community Movement Kang Mun Gyu and representative director of the National Agricultural Cooperative Federation of South Korea Song Sok U left Pyongyang today.
 It was seen off at the airport by Ho Hyok Phil, vice-chairman of the national reconciliation council, and officials concerned.    
 During its stay, the group visited the Mansudae Art Studio, Pyongyang Metro, the Korean Central History Museum, King Tong Myong's Mausoleum and King Tangun's Mausoleum and other places.
